page.title: 09Lydiard Tregoze Country Park
page.content: Lydiard Tregoze is named after{Robert {of Tregoze}who gained possession of the estate and surrounding area during the 12th Century . In{1420}the land became property of the{St.John family}who held it for the next 500 years until 1943 when Swindon Corporation bought the mansion and park for the use of the people of the area. The house, rebuilt in 1743 in the{classical Palladian style}is open to the public . A new{visitors centre}has been built to help people enjoy the extensive parkland providing information about the varied park wildlife, refreshments and changing rooms for the adjacent cricket and football pitches. Many species of birds live in the lake and woods including kingfishers,grebes ,water rails,blackcaps and most common woodland birds.
